TopicTitle: What do you spend your free-time doing? (Besides ksp and stuff)

Articles.Content:
Normally I like to spend time on a minecraft server, and while doing that, I work on this: http://www.yourworldoftext.com/~lordmuffin/

Yeah, that's basically it. What do YOU do?
I also play on Minecraft servers and wait anxiously for the ICBM mod for Minecraft. I also play World Conquer 2 on the iPad. Good for strategy.

I play games.

MC, Space engineers, Civ, etc
Every morning when I get home from work I grab a bowl of frosted mini wheats spooners and play counter strike source for a while before bed.
Mainly sports and going out clubbing with friends. Trying to get fit again after a couple of years of not doing much.
Rock climbing (mostly indoors, sometimes outdoors) and Wing Chun. Most of my free time is spent on university homeworks/projects though

Besides school and whatnot, I love watching YouTube and playing a variety of games. Some of these are Space Engine, Seed of Andromeda, and occasionally Roblox. I also like making digital artwork, mostly KSP stuff.
I sit around on the KSP forum Steam chat, while making bad jokes, playing games and watching rocket launches.
Work & sleep.
Read iss blog, learn (or try to learn) another language, sleep, eat, twitter, go on a friend's website, school, and my two favourite apps that need a time warp like ksp.

Europa Universalis IV

'I shall rule the world!'

Wait! Rebels? In ALL of my provinces? D'oh!

I play EVE (on again off again, currently On),

and sometimes this (although it is not a game):
Somehow i don't like all that threads collecting personal information. No personal data from me.
I tend to play Arma 3, War Thunder, X-Com Long War, Xenonauts, and watch random youtube videos!

Rock climbing

There are a few climbers around which surprises me a bit. Maybe it is the nature of the KSP community, being unlike a lot of other gaming communities?

I have a friend who always looked down her nose at climbers. She wondered why I, with a real job and a university education would hang out with what she saw as "low life's"? What she didn't realize is that climbing is a technical sport that draws a lot of technical people. That scruffy looking guy in Camp 4 at Yosemite is just as likely to be a doctor or engineer as he is to be a climbing bum... I think that may be because a lot of people take it up as a result of being exposed to it through campus outdoor clubs.

Maybe that is also why there seem to be a few around here? This game has an appeal for technical people too. Maybe there's (for lack of a better phrase) "cross contamination"?

Same thing I've been doing for the last 25 years or so:

Ã¢â€ â€œ Ã¢â€ Ëœ Ã¢â€ â€™ + P

I like draw and write, to bike ride, read, browse the internet (I read a lot of webcomics), and listen to radio. I also spend a little time helping out with church stuff, suffering through uni work (But yay for holidays!) plotting the downfall of my enemies, and occasionally do the odd chore...

Also, sleeping and eating, as these are important for continued existence.
I've been learning how to program and began to master blender. I also play with my dog.
I fly R/C Planes when I get time - but KSP takes so much of that away

With regards to computer games at the moment Elite: Dangerous, GalCiv 3 and Civ Beyond Earth

Aside from this Internet, Reading, Friends and Programming

(although reading currently not so much, despite the fact that there are still the first 5 books of the Game of Thrones series waiting to be read)

Edited December 14, 2014 by Godot

Apart from PC stuff: amateur photography, train and planespotting, building model planes, hanging out with friends, and rowing.

Btw, this is what I shot yesterday, the so-called "tram of light" in Budapest:

Edited December 14, 2014 by jmiki8

Typewriting (Only got two machines, one manual one electric, love them with all my heart just like most mechanical devices I come across), Computing, Programming in QBasic (Don't laugh, I can't get the hang of any other language), building things with wood (With what limited tools I have), and writing poetry, tried writing proper stories but could never come up with worthwhile plots, just crap retellings of old folk stories.
